page.title: 01Hatfield Broad Oak, Essex.
page.content:
Our 12 square kilometre area is predominantly arable farmland with small areas of woodland and meadow. However, the focal point for the surrounding countryside is the picturesque and ancient village of Hatfield Broad Oak, which lies in the south-eastern section of the area.
The village has not always been called Hatfield Broad Oak. At the time of the first Domesday survey it was Hatfelda. From the 12th to the 17th centuries it was known as Hatfield Villa Regis or Hatfield Domini Regis but from the 17th century it has had its present name. This derives from a particularly large and old oak tree in nearby Hatfield Forest which last bore green leaves in the year 1859 and finally disappeared in 1924. A plaque still marks its site.
